description: Single storey rear extension (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
decision_conditions: The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) as the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse . Planning permission is therefore required.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue  of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) as the the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse, in conjunction with previous extensions:
i) would extend beyond the rear of the original dwellinghouse by more than 4 metres;
ii) would have more than a single storey and would extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 3 metres;
iii) would be within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse, and the height of the eaves of the enlarged part would exceed 3 metres;
iv) would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) as the proposal would result in the provision of a self-contained residential unit with no link to the existing dwelling. Planning permission is therefore required.
